text:
Zach Galifianakis returned with a new episode of his Funny or Die faux talk show Between Two Ferns on Thursday (June 14) and called on Jerry Seinfeld and Cardi B for a hilarious six-minute interview, in which Galiafinakis took aim at Seinfeld and showed hip-hop’s golden child (and her unborn child) a whole lot of love.

Explore Explore Cardi B See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news

Galifianakis begins to throw jabs at Seinfeld from the very beginning, when he expresses his disappointment in having the comedian on the show, especially after previously nabbing interviews with Hillary Clinton and President Obama. Galifianakis purposely mixes up Jerry’s last name, even going as far as to write that the Seinfeld star was only funny from 1993 to 1997. The Hangover actor quips that the show Seinfeld has “been a real launching pad for whites” and calls Seinfeld’s Netflix series Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee “lazy, car-based non-comedy.”

A little after the halfway mark, Galifianakis introduces his next and “better” guest, Cardi B, who takes the spotlight away from Seinfeld for the remainder of the interview. Galifianakis gifts Cardi with a gift for her baby, telling the rapper, “You are special, but the most important thing is that you’re relevant.”

Watch the hilarious interview below:
title: Watch Cardi B Hilariously Crash Jerry Seinfeld’s ‘Between Two Ferns’ Interview With Zach Galifianakis

meta_data.description: Zach Galifianakis's 'Between Two Ferns' Makes Its Return With Hilarious Cardi B & Jerry Seinfeld Interview

Galifianakis purposely mixes up Jerry's last name, even going as far as to write that the Seinfeld star was only funny from 1993 to 1997. The Hangover actor quips that the show Seinfeld has "been a real launching pad for whites" and calls Seinfeld's Netflix series Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee "lazy, car-based non-comedy."A little after the halfway mark, Galifianakis introduces his next and "better" guest, Cardi B, who takes the spotlight away from Seinfeld for the remainder of the interview.
